intro: Pseudocassine transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal pseudocassia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, often in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes. Pseudocassine transvaalensis is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
